required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of FLACS With Combination of LenSx® and Centurion®
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of FLACS (Femtosecond Laser Assisted Cataract Surgery) With Combination of LenSx® and Centurion®

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate cumulative dissipated energy (CDE), endothelial cell loss, and average torsional amplitude with combination of LenSx® and Centurion® compared to conventional cataract surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects will attend 7 scheduled visits: 1 pre-operative, 1 operative, and 5 post-operative.

primary_outcome.description: CDE (the energy dissipated at the incision point during the removal of cataractous lens) will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent change of corneal endothelial cell density (ECD)
secondary_outcome.description: Specular microscopy will be performed and endothelial cell density will be recorded.
Torsional amplitude will be recorded by Centurion® and measured as a percentage.

arm_group.description: FLACS in 1 eye, with manual conventional surgery in the fellow eye, as randomized
Manual conventional surgery in 1 eye, with FLACS in the fellow eye, as randomized

intervention.description: Femtosecond laser assisted cataract surgery consisting of LenSx® and Centurion® combination
Removal of cataractous lens by phacoemulsification
Phacoemulsification aspiration platform for use during cataract surgery
Femtosecond laser system used for continuous curvilinear capsulorhexis (CCC) and lens fragmentation during cataract surgery

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations
